content.rendered:
We have talked about Sharing Sets, Page Visibility and Guests, now we are going a bit of a different directions, how to take those pages and take the users and find out how to make then into different groups for audiences, folders, sharing groups, managing resources, and standard partner categories all at once. SHNIKES! I bet you’re like ‘girl, what feature are you talking about?’ Well the feature we are talking about here is available with just Partner Community/Partner Community Login licenses and it’s called Channel Programs. What are Channel Programs exactly? Great question, let’s break that down to the core.

Table of Contents

    What are Channel Programs

    Channel Programs are, again, part of the Partner Licensing functionality, and include 3 objects, Channel Program, Channel Program Level and Channel Program members. They make me think of the Salesforce Partner Program when I explain them, because they work to break partners into different groups and those groups into tiers.

    Channel Programs and Channel levels to promote partners in your Community, to encourage them to sell more by giving more access with different levels as they go up in rank. You can also connect partners to a Partner Scorecard to track how they are doing for account managers, channel managers, leadership so how well they are or aren’t doing is easily seen. We’ll dig into that scorecard at another time.

    Channel Program

    You use Channel Programs to organize Partner Users into different groups, such as by GEO – US Partners, EMEA Partners, APAC Partners, group – VAR, Channel, Distributor, ISO, ISV – those individual groupings are the Channel Program. If you break your partners down differently – do your thing, maybe you have your Product vs Services vs Tech partners, whatever is you have above the individual levels, that’s the program.

    Now the Levels, that’s where it gets to the rankings, are your partners, Gold, Silver, Bronze, perhaps you have it based on their sales total or sales with you or based on their company size, or the number of years they have been with you, or their deal submitted to deal closed ratio. No matter what you use as the Channel Program Level criteria, those individual Levels are defined within the Partner Program. This is great for rewarding them as they go up to get more access within the Community 100% declaratively.

    Channel Program Level

    I have even seen Channel Program Levels that are setup up for sub geographies within the higher level geographies where they do not have rankings – Europe as the program than each country, Germany, France, Ireland, Spain, Italy, etc as the Levels. This is also a great way to make your security with clicks for things such as regulations – Eg. if you can’t show info to users in France or Germany but you can if they are in the UK partner partner program group or the Spain group – channel program level is an option, WITHOUT ANY CODE AT ALL.

    Channel Program Member

    Your Channel Program Members are the Partners in each group. You have a lookup to the Channel Program Level that’s required, a Master Detail to the Channel Program, and then a Lookup to the Account that is required. Now everyone on the Account is tied to that Channel Program Level. Accounts can be tied to multiple Channel Programs and Multiple Channel Program Levels, this can be handy if they have an ISV and ISO relationship and need access to both Channel Programs and have different levels in each.

    Sharing & Security Superpowers

    Now that we have reviewed a bit more about each object involved, I want to dig more into their sharing and security superpowers….

    So the branding and branding sets, oh how I love thee, let me count the ways… oh wait different post, but still related, Channel Programs

    Now step one, we need to make some permission sets so that Partners can see what they need to see for Channel Programs for those that should see them, and then one for the internal users, such as the Channel Manager – that role comes up quite a bit in the Community world – so that that person can manage the partners and the Channels Programs, Channel Program Levels, and Channel Program Members

    Channel Manager Perms

    What is a Channel Manager? The Channel Manager/Channel Account Manager is the internal user that manages your Partner Accounts. They create Partner Accounts, and with how Community users work, the Partner Roles assigned to them fall under them in the hierarchy. The data owned by Partners then rolls up so it is visible to the Channel Manager because of how they are above the Partners in the Role Hierarchy. Please note that Partner Roles are not visible on the standard Role Hierarchy page, but they do exist below the Channel Manager.

    General Permissions/Access

    • Grant the “PermissionsManagePartners” permission
      • When this permission is enabled, channel managers can create partner accounts and partner users.
    • Assign record types to channel manager profiles.
      • For example, the Lightning Partner Management solution includes two lead record types: one to track sales leads and the other to register deals. Make sure that your channel manager has access to both.
    • Make the Partner Account field visible to channel managers on Leads, Accounts, and Opportunities.
      • If you created a custom Partner/Partner Account fields on any other Standard or Custom objects and you are using it for Sharing Sets, make sure that field is visible and on the page layout your Channel Manager as well
    • Make sure the Channel Manager has the Files related list visible on any objects you will share files with Partners on
    • Ensure they have the Enable Partner Account button on the Account page layout
    • Make the Enable Partner User field is on the Contact page layout (remember, Partners do not work with Person Accounts)

    Channel Manager Channel Program Perm Set

    Create a Permission Set that can be assigned to the Channel Manager. Your Channel Manager will have a Standard Salesforce License, they need to have access to Leads, Opportunities, the Channel Program, Channel Program Level, Channel Program Member and all other objects the Partner has access to. That will require a Standard Salesforce License.

    1. Go to Setup – Permission Sets – New
    2. Create the Perm Set Details
      • Name your Permission Set something recognizable, Eg. Partner Community: Channel Manager Channel Program Access.
        1. I do like adding where it is used in the Permission Set name to group each communities perm sets together, either the full name or abbreviated.
      • Add a Description – Access to the Channel Program object for the Channel Account Manager in the MeighanRocks Partner Community.
        1. I call out which community because you can have numerous communities, best to have permission sets for each one so that they can be properly assigned to each team and managed separately.
      • License Type – Standard User
        • So now that who spiel I went through before about why they have to be a Standard User comes into play, I select the License type whenever I can on my Perm Sets, especially when dealing with Community security.
    3. Save
    4. Access the Object Settings on the Permission Set main detail page
    5. Go to Channel Programs and click Edit
    6. Grant Access to the Channel ProgramMake the Tab for the Channel Program Visible
    7. Grant CRU (Create, Read, Edit) access on the Channel Program object
    1. Save

    If you have the same Channel Manager that will manage the Channel Programs and Channel Program Levels, you can add Channel Program Levels to this Permission set, by going to the Channel Program Level object on this permission set and granting CRU (Create, Read, Edit) and Tab visibility.

    If, however, you have a different user that will be managing levels we want to pretty much repeat the same process and create another permission set for the Channel Manager but with the Channel Program Level using the steps below

    Channel Manager Channel Program Level Perm Set

    Only if you have Channel Programs and Channel Program Levels managed by different User(s) and did not grant Channel Program Level Access on the prior Permission Set, follow these steps:

    1. Go to Setup – Permission Sets – New
    2. Create the Perm Set Details
      • Name your Permission Set something recognizable, Eg. Partner Community: Channel Manager Channel Program Access.
        • I do like adding where it is used in the Permission Set name to group each communities perm sets together, either the full name or abbreviated.
      • Add a Description – Access to the Channel Program object for the Channel Account Manager in the MeighanRocks Partner Community.
        • I call out which community because you can have numerous communities, best to have permission sets for each one so that they can be properly assigned to each team and managed separately.
      • License Type – Standard User
        • So now that who spiel I went through before about why they have to be a Standard User comes into play, I select the License type whenever I can on my Perm Sets, especially when dealing with Community security.
    3. Save
    4. Access the Object Settings on the Permission Set main detail page
    5. Go to Channel Program Level and click Edit
    6. Grant Access to the Channel Program Level
      • Make the Tab for the Channel Program Level Visible
      • Grant CRU (Create, Read, Edit) access on the Channel Program Level object
    7. Save

    Assign Permission to the Channel Manager

    Now that we have the Permission Set(s) we need to the Channel Manager(s).

    • Go to Setup – Manage Users – Users
    • Select the Channel Manager(s) you want to have the Permission Sets
    • Add the Permission Sets to the Users

    You can also assign users directly on the Permission Set using the “Manage Assignments” button.

    Partner Account Field – Leads

    Now that the Channel Program and Channel Program Level permissions are assigned to the Channel Manager, they need access to the Partner Account field on the Lead and Opportunity object. (I know I mentioned it above, and here is how you do it). First the reason why – these fields are used for Sharing and for the Partner Scorecard. The Partner Scorecard won’t work if these fields don’t show.

    1. Go to the Setup – Security Controls – Field Accessibility
    2. Select the Lead object
    3. Choose the Partner Account field from the fields dropdown
    4. Make sure the Profile(s) assigned to your Channel Manager(s) have access to the Partner Account Field
    1. If the field is Hidden, click the text ‘Hidden’ next to the Profile to update
    2. Check Visible for the Profile
    3. Save

    Partner Account Field – Opportunities

    Now we need to repeat this same process on Opportunities for the same reason, Channel Managers need to manage their Partners and the Partner Scorecard requires access to the Partner Account field

    1. Go to the Setup – Security Controls – Field Accessibility
    2. Select the Opportunity object
    3. Choose the Partner Account field from the fields dropdown
    4. Make sure the Profile(s) assigned to your Channel Manager(s) have access to the Partner Account Field
    1. If the field is Hidden, click the text ‘Hidden’ next to the Profile to update
    2. Check Visible for the Profile
    3. Save

    To wrap up the field permissions, do a quick scan to make sure your Channel Managers have the right access to anything custom you might need them to have as well.

    Setup Channel Program Objects

    Now that we have our permissions setup for the Internal Channel Manager, we can start making our Channel Program Objects. Let’s get some Channel Programs, Levels and Members setup within our Community shall we? Awesome!

    Setup Record Types

    You don’t want to be using the Master Record Type, the best practice is to have a Record Type on the objects as your default that isn’t ‘Master‘. Since we are doing a very basic setup, we will just create a Record Type called ‘Standard‘ on each object.

    Channel Program Record Type

    For the Channel Program we want to create our Standard Record Type, we will do this in Setup on the object itself.

    1. Go to the Channel Program object in Setup
      • In Classic, Channel Programs are under Setup – Customize – Communities – Channel Programs – Record Types
      • In Lightning, you’ll also find them in setup, but in the Object Manager, then Go to Channel Programs on the list page, click Channel Programs, the Record Types on the Left Navigation
    2. Click New on the Record Type Page
    3. Create Your Record Type
      • Name your Record Type as you choose, I use ‘Standard‘ for my base Record Types
      • Add a description to the Record Type
      • Since we only have one Page Layout, we don’t need to change the layout per Profile.
    4. Click Save

    Channel Program Level Record Type

    Channel Program Member Record Type

    Setup Page Layouts

    Now that we have our permissions we need to pretty on up our page layouts. When the Channel Program, Channel Program Level objects arrive OOTB (Out of the Box) they don’t have any related lists on them, bummer dude. So we will fix that right on up. Starting with the Channel Program.

    Channel Program Page Layout

    For the Channel Program Page Layout we want to start with adding the Related Lists.

    Channel Program Related Lists
    1. Go to the Channel Program object in Setup
      • In Classic, Channel Programs are under Setup – Customize – Communities – Channel Programs – Page Layout
      • In Lightning, you’ll also find them in setup, but in the Object Manager, then Go to Channel Programs on the list page, click Channel Programs, once that page Loads, click Page Layouts on the left side navigation
    2. Click Edit next to the Channel Program Layout
    3. Go to Related Lists
    4. Add the Channel Program Level and Channel Program Member related lists.
      • I also added Channel Program History, Open Activities, Activity History related lists
    5. Add the Name field. to the Channel Program Member related List
    6. Optional: I add the Activity and Activity History Related Lists
      • Activity History: Since the Channel Program isn’t an object that is for making calls/reaching out to customers, I reduce the buttons to just Send Email, and View All.
    7. Click Quick Save
    Channel Program Mobile and Lightning Quick Actions

    Next up we want to edit the Salesforce Mobile and Lightning Quick Actions on the page, why? because we don’t need all of them, and we don’t want to have junk on the screen.

    1. Remove the unnecessary items from the Channel Program Salesforce Mobile and Lightning Quick Actions
    2. This includes ‘New Account’, ‘New Opportunity’, ‘New Lead’, ‘New Case’, ‘New Member’
    3. If you are not using Approvals on the Channel Program object, remove ‘Submit for Approval’
    1. Click Quick Save
    Channel Program Mini Page Layout

    The next item on the Channel Program Page Layout to update is the mini Page Layout. The mini Page Layout is used when you hoover for record details and the info in the Recent Items section in the Classic sidebar. Also, anything that is required/always displayed on the Record Detail will automatically show on the mini Page Layout and cannot be removed.

    1. Click the mini Page Layout link on the Channel Program Page Layout edit screen
    2. Add the fields you want to have displayed
      • Only fields on the Page Layout are visible, to add a different field you need to add that field to the Channel Page Layout first
      • You can move the fields with the up and down arrows
    3. Add the Related Lists you want on the mini Page Layout
      • Only Related Lists on the Page Layout are visible, to add a different Related List you need to add that Related List to the Channel Page Layout first
      • The max number of Related Lists you can add is 5, but try to stay under 5, only use what you need
    4. Select the fields (if available) to display on the Related List
      • Only fields on the Related List on Page Layout are visible, to add a different field you need to add that field to the Related List the Channel Page Layout first
    5. Click Save

    You will be redirected back to your Channel Program Page Layout, here you can do a final review of the Page Layout.

    1. Click Save on the Page Layout

    Channel Program Compact Layout

    We all know Lightning is the future & the future is now, so making Compact Layouts is a necessity. The compact layout is what determines the fields in the Headline/banner component.

    1. First Click New on the Compact Layout screen

    Channel Program Level Page Layout

    For the Channel Program Level, we want to do most of what we did on the Channel Program layout, with a few small changes Header/Banner components.

    Channel Program Level Related Lists
    1. Go to the Channel Program Level object in Setup
      • In Classic, Channel Programs are under Setup – Customize – Communities – Channel Program Levels – Page Layout
      • In Lightning, you’ll also find them in setup, but in the Object Manager, then Go to Channel Program Levels on the list page, click Channel Program Level, once that page Loads, click Page Layouts on the left side navigation
    2. Click Edit next to the Channel Program Level Layout
    3. Go to Related Lists
    4. Add the Channel Program Member related list
      • Add the Name field to the Channel Program Member related List
    5. Optional: I add the Activity and Activity History Related Lists
      • Activity History: Since the Channel Program Level, and just like Channel Program, I reduce the buttons to just Send Email, and View All.
    6. Click Quick Save
    Channel Program Level Mobile and Lightning Quick Actions

    Again, we want to remove anything we don’t need here so we have a nice clean screen and clean button options on our Lightning Record Detail pages for the end users.

    1. Remove the unnecessary items from the Channel Program Level Salesforce Mobile and Lightning Quick Actions
    2. This again includes ‘New Account’, ‘New Opportunity’, ‘New Lead’, ‘New Case’, ‘New Member’, etc
    3. If you are not using Approvals on the Channel Program Level object, remove ‘Submit for Approval’
    1. Click Quick Save
    Channel Program Level Mini Page Layout

    Again, best practice, we need to get that min page layout updated. We shouldn’t have users seeing just a record name when they hoover, it’s poor usability. So let’s get the Channel Program Level mini layout updated.

    1. Click the mini Page Layout link on the Channel Program Level Page Layout edit screen
    2. Add the fields you want to have displayed
      • Only fields on the Page Layout are visible, same as with the Channel Program
      • You can move the fields with the up and down arrows
    3. Add the Related Lists you want on the mini Page Layout
      • I added the Channel Program Members
      • Here you. are also limited to just 5 Related Lists, but again, keep it to the minimum you need
    4. Select the fields (if available) to display on the Related List
      • Only fields on the Related List on Page Layout are visible, see above for more details
    5. Click Save
    6. Review the Channel Program Level Page Layout as a whole
    7. Optional: On the Page Layout, ensure your Section Properties for each Field Section make sense.
    8. Click Save on the Channel Program Level Page Layout

    Channel Program Level Compact Layout

    So the Channel Program Level object needs a Compact Layout as well. OOTB there is only the Name field on the Compact Layout, we need to increase that usability for the Channel teams. So Let’s get back in there on the Channel Program Level object and make a Compact Layout.

    1. Go to the object
    2. Click New
    3. Name your Compact Layout something distinguishable, for now and later. That way if you have a 2nd or 3rd for additional Record Types you can tell which is which
    4. Add the fields you want to have on the top of the page
      • I selected Owner, Channel Program, and Rank
    5. Click Save

    Now that you have created the Compact Layout you need to assign the Compact Layout.

    1. Click

    Channel Program Member Page Layout

    The Channel Program Member, the connection to the Partner Account and Channel Program Level and Channel Program. This object is the pin that holds the Channel Program together with the Partner Users. Time to clean it up as well.

    Channel Program Member Related Lists
    1. Add the Channel Program Member History to the Related Lists.
    2. Add the Account, Channel Program, and Channel Program Level to the Expanded Lookups.
    3. On the Channel Program Member Page Layout, update the Field Sections to be properly laid out and Top-Down (if appropriate)
    4. Click Quick Save
    Channel Program Member Mini Page Layout
    1. Click the Mini Page Layout button on the Channel Program Member page layout.
    2. Add the Owner Name to the Account, Channel Program, and Channel Program Level fields.
    3. If desired add any related lists.
    4. Click Save.

    Compact Layouts

    1. Review the Channel Program Member Page Layout to ensure it is complete and how you want it to look
    2. Click Save

    Channel Program Search Filter Fields

    Channel Program Member Compact Layout

    Search Layouts

    The Channel Program and Channel Program Level both have the ability to have Search Layouts created. These are an important part of every object that needs to be configured that often go overlooked. When you have a lookup box, your search filter fields, the fields on your Recently Viewed list view, the fields that show on a lookup below the Record Name – those are all held in Search Layouts. Make sure you don’t miss them in the future and check to make sure your objects all have them configured currently.

    Search Layout

    Search Layout: Customize which fields display for users in search results, search filter fields, lookup dialogs, the recent records lists on tab home pages in Salesforce Classic.
    You can specify a different set of fields to show in each search layout. The settings apply to all users in your organization and Salesforce Customer Portal.

    Classic

    To add more field column when using Global Search for any record search

    Click on Setup | Customize | Select your desired object | Search layout | Edit Search layout | Add the fields from “Available box to Selected box” and click on Save button.

    Lightning

    Lightning: Click on Setup | Object Manager | Select your desired object | Search layout | Edit Search layout | Add the fields from “Available box to Selected box” and click on Save button.
    For more details see Customize Search Layouts.

    Lookup Dialogue

    2) Lookup Dialog: After enabling enhanced lookups, specify which fields users can use to filter lookup search results. If you don’t specify any fields, your users can’t use filters in enhanced lookup dialogs.

    Classic

    Classic: Click on Setup | Customize | Select your desired object | Search layout | Edit Lookup Dialog | Add the fields from Available box to Selected box and click on Save button.​

    Lightning

    Lightning: Click on Setup | Object Manager | Select your desired object | Search layout | Edit Lookup Dialog | Add the fields from Available box to Selected box and click on Save button.
    For more details see Specify Lookup Search Filter Fields.

    Object Tab

    3) Object tab example (Account tab) from Search Layout: The below steps will help you to add more field columns on “Recent Viewed Records” on standard or custom object:

    Classic

    Classic: Click on Setup | Customize | Select your desired object | Search layout | Edit eg: Object (Account) tab | Add the fields from Available box to Selected box and click on Save button.

    Lightning

    Lightning: Click on Setup | Object Manager | Select your desired object | Search layout | Edit eg: Object (Account) tab | Add the fields from Available box to Selected box and click on Save button.

    List View on Search Layout

    4) Object List View on Search Layout: To add button option on Any List View

    Classic


    Classic: Click on Setup | Customize | Select your desired object | Search layout | Edit example : Object (Account) List View | Add Button | click on Save button.

    Lightning

    Lightning: Click on Setup | Object Manager | Select your desired object | Search layout | Edit example : Object (Account) List View | Add Button | click on Save button.
    For more details see Add or Remove Buttons on a List Vie

    1. Go to Setup
    2. Click Channel Programs
    3. Search Layouts
    4. Customize as you see fit

    Channel Program Level Search Filter Fields

    Repeat for Channel Program Level

    1. Go to Setup
    2. Click Channel Programs
    3. Search Layouts
    4. Customize as you see fit

    Lights, Camera, Actions!

    Channel Program Actions

    Channel Program Level Action

    Channel Program Member Action

    Create Your Channel Program Data

    Create Channel Program

    Channel Program – do this in salesforce by creating a record

    Create Channel Program Levels

    Create channel program level data – again a record in Salesforce. This time using your action on the Channel Program.

    1. On your channel program click new to create a Channel Program Level
    2. Enter the name, channel program, rank, and a description.
    3. Save the channel program level.

    Setup Your Sharing

    Share Some Objects

    Time for your sharing settings…. sharing records and object data

    Share some Reports

    Resolve Misunderstandings

    • Channel programs themselves do NOT remove any visibility – if users couldn’t see things before thy can’t now, and they won’t lose access to anything they had access to by joining a channel group –
      • I read on a blog out there “Partner users within a channel program or level can no longer see others’ accounts and opportunities, this is only if you remove sharing for them on other accounts, if you keep their account visibility open they still have access to other accounts”
    • Accounts can be in multiple groups
    • The Channel Program Members are Accounts not individuals
    • Accounts can be in multiple Channel Programs
    • Set External OWD (organization-wide default) to Private on Channel Program Level and Channel Program Member.
    • Grant each partner user access to their level and member via Sharing Set or Manual Share.
    • You can use Channel Program Member sharing groups to manage access to resources within levels, such as public queues, list views, sharing rules, and folders
    • Use sharing groups to manage Channel Program members.
      • When new partner users join a team, you can add them to a Channel Program Member group.
    • You can move partner users to another group when they are promoted, demoted, or transitioned to a different area of expertise.
    • Deleting a partner account that was added as a channel program member, deletes the associated channel program member.
      • Undeleting the partner account brings back the account and the channel program member, but the account is no longer enabled as a partner account.
    • Contact Salesforce Customer Support to increase the number of channel program members in your organization beyond the current limit.

What are Channel Programs exactly? Great question, let’s break that down to the core.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Community Sharing Part 1: Sharing Sets – Your First Step in Sharing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Sharing Sets are an amazing superpower that comes with your Communities. They are a way to share with Community License types and Community users. Keep in mind, this type of security and sharing is only available for your community users, it is not available to share with internal users.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Community Sharing Part 2: Guest Page Visibility
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: This post we expore guest user visibily in Experience Cloud. Every Community has a Guest User and Guest User Profile. A guest is someone that can see your community before they login - an Unauthenticated user. Each time a community or portal is created, Salesforce auto-creates a guest user profile…

img.alt_text: Community Sharing part 2_ Guest Page Visibility

jetpack-related-posts.title: Native CMS
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Out of the box you you have 3 types of CMS, native CMS is one of those 3. Learn all about it from how to create articles, use cases, and why use Native CMS.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce #OhanaSlack
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Salesforce #OhanaSlack is a Slack Workspace that's available to connect with theSalesforce community and get real time help 24/7.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Lightning Ideas Delivered
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Know what I like about Salesforce? Well, one thing I really like.... The fact that they listen, seriously.  Are you using the IdeaExchange?  If not, you need to stop reading now, and go check it out before you read on.  Not only do I like the IdeaExchange so I can…

jetpack-related-posts.title: List Custom Settings
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: What is a Custom Setting?  We talked about Hierarchy Custom Settings in the Keep Clean Validation Rules with Custom Settings post, which let you set a default field value for the organization, then you can assign a value to a Profile or User.  List Custom Settings are a bit different, they don't…
